title: Design-Based Experimental Learning Project for Language Education Innovation in the Fourth Industrial Revolution Era

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the field, foundational language education theory (grammar, vocabulary acquisition principles), and digital content creation experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning environments requiring digital tool proficiency, with a focus on collaborative and language education content creation via personal devices (BYOD). Projects emphasize simultaneous assessment of learners' creative expression and language application skills.

learning_goals: ≥85% of learners will perform collaborative design processes (e.g., prototyping, feedback) using digital platforms and analyze text structures and vocabulary usage in interactive language education content.

Participants will plan a team-based interactive storytelling tool development project for language education, complete a prototype and a 10-minute demonstration presentation within 6 months. The project must meet ≥70% of evaluation criteria (functionality 40%, educational effectiveness 30%, creativity 30%) and demonstrate improvements in expressive and reading comprehension skills within language learning contexts.
All learners will enhance their ability to integrate design thinking with language education (reading, writing, speaking, listening) through ≥3 formative assessments during the course.

resources: Digital Design Software (Adobe XD, Canva, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
